lines: Make a toasted sandwich
Drink some water (maybe put some fruit in it)
Do your washing (fold it too if your feeling good)
Write in your journal
Look at your calendar and think about the week ahead
Watch a litte bit of a tv show or movie
Water some plants
Call or online chat with someone you haven't seen in ages (preferably with someone who doesn't smoke!)
Go for a walk around the block
Read a book or magazine - you deserve some me time!
Go somewhere new you've been curious about
Go for a random swim (pools, beach, puddle - you decide)
Colour co-ordinate your wardrobe
Dry some flowers
Cook something difficult (of you fail make it again tomorrow!)
Decorate a neglected part of your whare
Take some interesting photos/selfies
Make a moodboard of pictures that inspire you
Read your star sign
Listen to some music (maybe even find a quiet place and sing along)
Check on upcoming concerts in your city
Sunbathe (or moon bathe)
Check the maramataka calendar and what kind of moon it is
Dance for 10 minutes
Connect with someone you don't know but want to know
Go climb a tree
Get some old clothes together and donate them
Sing a waiata
Learn a karakia you don't know
Start a whānau chat thread to reconnect with everyone
Do some grooming you've been delaying
Sort out your wardrobe (or make-up, shoes, kid's toys)
Make a hot drink and have some quiet time
Learn a language for 5 minutes a day - Ka kōrero Māori koe?
Clean the windows
Go to the library
Renovate a part of your whare
Wash your car (or someone else's)
Make your bed (or some else's)
Light a candle
Practice learning an instrument
Play a video game
Look online for other stories about other people quitting
Make some art and give it to a friend
Preserve some fruit
Go fishing!
Watch kapa haka videos
Get $1 and open a savings account
Write someone a letter and post it
Make a physical goal and practice it every day
Practice juggling
Do a drawing of someone you love
Take a blanket somewhere pretty and enjoy the view
Do some chopping and meal prep for you or your whānau
Sew up something that needs mending
Do a home-made face mask
Make a fantasy bucket list
Organise some old items into storage boxes
Build a free website about something you find interesting
Start a piggy bank for the tamariki in your life with some spare change
Look at free whānau events in your area and make plans to attend
Look around for items you can recycle and make into something new
Have some cute animal time with a pet in your life
Do a complicated hairstyle on yourself or someone you love
Learn how to weave
Make a traditional Māori kai
Learn choreography of your favourite artist
Tutor someone in a topic you enjoy
Get a yo-yo, learn some tricks online
Take your kuia or koro out for the day
Know anyone with some good trees? Pick some fruit or flowers
Make some bread! Rewana, fried, boujee - you decide
Make some jewellery for friends and whānau
Replace all the old lightbulbs in the whare with eco-friendly ones that last for years
Clean up your social media pages - ka kite old pics and nasty comments!
Walk up your local maunga and check out the view - gets you fit too
Set up a reward list for when you've been smokefree for 1, 2, 3 or 100 years
Join a sports team! Or go cheer for your favourite team if that's not your style
Look up community college night courses in your neighbourhood
Go to your local art gallery or community centre, have a look around
TV Networks often have free tickets - be a studio audience member on a local tv show
Design your dream home
Look up what laws the government will be voting on this week
Print out digital photos you love
Enter some competitions and giveaways - you never know your luck!
Research an old whānau member you never got to meet
Wear something out to the shops that you keep saying you'll wear, but don't
Learn about kawakawa tea
Get some cool stickers and put them on your stuff - cos guess what, you're never too old for cool stickers
Close your eyes and take some long deep breaths
Dust, mop and wipe down some surfaces
Lift some weights - if you don't have any try bags of rice, cans of food, or big handfuls of cutlery
Look at a world map and think about places you might like to go one day (wishful thinking allowed!)
Talk to someone you know who has quit smoking succesfully and ask them to be your mentor/buddy
Look up Decoupage - cut up old pics from books/magazines and glue them to objects that need a glow up
Try to learn some history about the area you live in - has it always been like this?
Start a dream diary and start recording your interesting dreams
Learn how to play a card game you don't know
Go pick up some litter - especially by nearby awa
Do a youtube video about your non-smoking journey
Write a list of all the things you're grateful for!
Trim, paint, file basically.... do your nails!
Scrapbook - cut out some pictures and put them in your journal :)
Make a poi :-)
Make a friendship bracelet, knit, crochet or cross-stitch.... just keep those hands busy ;)
